result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Batterers Intervention program.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug/alcohol screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC.  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Nonmandatory costs waived.
-Court sets restitution at zero.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Jaron Triplett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in court, in custody.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Jerry Jaron Triplett.  Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing proceeded. Statements made as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 33 MONTHS, with credit for 265 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 15 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS. 

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.
- Batters intervention program.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Random drug/alcohol screens.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Non-mandatory costs waived.
- No violent contact with victim.

*Court sets restitution at zero.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett not in court, in custody.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Jerry Jaron Triplett.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is in court for a sentencing. This case was tabbed to Judge Havas in error.  It should be before Judge Crivello.  Case is adjourned to 10-24-22 at 10:30 am for sentencing before Judge Crivello.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett not in court, in custody.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Jerry Jaron Triplett.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Michelle Grasso for Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for sentencing hearing. Defense requested adjournment due to defendant not being produced. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36; IN PERSON. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Jury trial exhibit from 8/8/22 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 789.
Received and Filed: Exhibit List and Stipulation for Return/Destruction of Original Exhibits for Jury Trial on August 8, 2022
Court dismisses jurors off record.  Jurors sent back to Jury Management.

Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in court with attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for continued jury trial (Day 2 AM Session).  However, defendant wishes to change plea.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Desirae Sanchez (Milwaukee Dispatcher).  Exhibit 1 received.  Defense objects to State publishing exhibit 1.  At the hour of 4:33 PM, the jury is dismissed for the day, but ordered to return at 08:45 AM on August 9, 2022 to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Discussions regarding exhibit 1 objections set forth on the record.  Jury trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in court with attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso and Julie Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a jury trial (PM Session).  Court addresses motions in limine.  Jury panel in court at the hour of 2:01 PM.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 2:08 PM.  Sidebar held.  Voir dire continued.  Sidebar held.  Jury out of the box at 3:33 PM.  Sidebar discussions set forth on the record.  

Jury in the box at 3:57 PM.
Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Sidebar held.

Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in court with attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a speedy jury trial from Branch 10, Judge Havas (AM Session).  State filed a notice of motion and motion for admission of 911 call.  Arguments heard.  Court GRANTS State's motion for admission.  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  Case passed to 1:15 PM.
This case transferred to Br. 36, Judge Crivello for spin Jury Trial.
Motion and Notice of Motion for Bail Reduction from Defendant (Jerry Triplett #2022001383- 8885 S 68th St Franklin, WI)

Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court, defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett not in court, in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for final pretrial.  Case remains in trial posture.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Jury trial remains scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motions in Limine
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Admission of 911 Recording
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  EXPIRES 8/21/2022.

Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in court with attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerry Jaron Triplett appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defense's bail motion as to bail amount heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defense bail motion.  Defense counsel requests SPEEDY jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared for final pretrial on 7/18/2022 at 1:30 pm  Court vacates previously scheduled jury trial dates.   Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court, defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in court with Attorney Martin Russell Tanz; both appear by video.  Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. DeBraska.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss - Untimely Preliminary Hearing.  (Jerry J. Triplett - #2022001383, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Tanz is newly appointed and needs more time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with TMT.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $12,500.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No contact order monitoring only.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Jerry Jaron Triplett in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
